p: To perform antioxidant assays, a methanolic extract was first prepared from the samples. Then, the total flavonoid and phenol content of the extracts was determined using the method found in Marinova et al. [ 66] and Sakanaka et al. [ 67]. Ling and Zhaoâ€™s method was used to find out superoxide radical scavenging percentage [ 68]. To estimate nitric oxide radical scavenging percentage, the Garrat method was employed [ 69]. 1,1-diphenyl-2-picrylhydrazyl (DPPH) radical scavenging percentage was also measured by the procedure described in Brand-Williams et al. [ 70]. This method, with some modifications, was also used to measure chain-breaking activity using the DPPH reagent [ 70].
